column2: Paradiso Software is hiring for  Remote Work -- Account Manager/ BDM -- Sales Role  for Globalized Market , candidate who is passionate about sales, creating leads, getting business to the footsteps of the company & taking it to next level !!  Job Description:  We are seeking a dynamic and proactive IT Services Consultant with a hunting mentality to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong sales background with a proven track record of success in selling IT services. As an IT Services Consultant, you will be responsible for identifying and acquiring new clients while also nurturing existing relationships to drive revenue growth.?  Responsibilities:   End to end sales-lead gen, guiding junior people, requirement gathering, demos, contract closing and post sales support, you need to have at least 4 years of experience in end-to-end sales cycle for IT services projects   Proactively identify and pursue new business opportunities in the IT services sector.? Develop and maintain a robust sales pipeline through cold calling, networking, and other lead generation activities.? Conduct thorough needs assessments with potential clients to understand their IT challenges and objectives.? Present tailored solutions to clients that align with their business goals and address their pain points.? Collaborate with internal teams to develop customized proposals and pricing strategies.? Negotiate contracts and close deals to meet or exceed sales targets.? Build and maintain strong relationships with clients to ensure high levels of satisfaction and retention.? Stay informed about industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitors' offerings.? Provide ongoing support and guidance to clients throughout the sales process and beyond.? Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and trade shows to promote our IT services offerings.? - Sell a range of IT services including ARP, CRM, development, and AI solutions.?- Proactively identify and pursue new business opportunities in the IT services sector.?- Build and maintain strong client relationships, deeply understanding their needs.?- Deliver persuasive sales presentations and negotiate contracts effectively.?- Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies, integrating them into sales strategies.?   Qualifications:   Bachelor's degree in business administration, Information Technology, or a related field (preferred).? Proven track record of success in B2B sales, particularly in selling IT services.? Strong understanding of IT concepts and technologies, including ARP, CRM, software development, and AI.? Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasively.? Self-motivated with a proactive, "hunter" mentality and a strong drive to succeed.? Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.? Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think strategically and creatively.? Experience using CRM software (e.g., Salesforce) and other sales tools to manage leads and opportunities.? Willingness to travel as needed to meet with clients and attend industry events.? Professional certifications in sales or IT (e.g., ITIL, CompTIA, Salesforce Certified Sales Professional) are a plus.? If you are a results-oriented individual with a passion for technology and a proven ability to drive sales, we want to hear from you. Join our team and help us deliver innovative IT solutions to clients across industries.

column2: Overview:   As a Channel Loyalty   Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies to enhance loyalty among our channel partners, ensuring their long-term commitment and engagement. You will work closely with the sales and marketing teams to identify growth opportunities and foster strong relationships with our partners. The role requires a blend of analytical skills, strategic thinking, and excellent communication abilities.   Key   Responsibilities:   1.   Digital Reward Program Development:  Design,   implement, and manage digital reward programs tailored to our B2B channel partners. Develop innovative reward structures and incentives to drive   partner engagement, sales growth, and brand advocacy.   2.   Platform Selection and Management:  Identify and   evaluate digital reward platforms and technologies suitable for our B2B   partner ecosystem. Manage the implementation and integration of chosen   platforms, ensuring seamless operation and user experience.   3.   Partner Relationship Management:  Build and   maintain strong relationships with key B2B channel partners, acting as the   primary point of contact for all digital reward program-related matters.   Understand partner needs and preferences to tailor reward programs   accordingly.   4.   Strategic Planning:  Collaborate   with cross-functional teams to develop strategic plans for digital reward   programs, aligned with overall business objectives. Analyze market trends,   competitor activities, and partner feedback to drive program innovation.   5.   Performance Analysis:  Monitor and   analyze the performance of digital reward programs using key metrics such as   partner engagement, redemption rates, and ROI. Utilize data-driven insights   to optimize program effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.   6.   Communication and Engagement:  Regularly   communicate program updates, new rewards, and incentives to B2B partners to   maintain high levels of engagement. Develop marketing collateral and   campaigns to promote digital rewards and drive partner participation.   Qualifications:   Bachelors degree in   business administration, Marketing, or related field. Masters degree is a   plus.   Minimum 5 years of experience in   B2B channel management, partner relationship management, or loyalty program   management, with a focus on digital rewards.   Deep understanding   of digital reward platforms and technologies, with experience in selecting   and implementing such platforms.   Strong analytical   skills with the ability to interpret data and derive actionable insights.   Excellent   communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively   engage with B2B partners and internal stakeholders.   Strategic thinker   with the ability to develop and execute innovative digital reward strategies.   Detail-oriented with   strong organizational and project management skills.   Familiarity with CRM   systems, loyalty management platforms, and digital marketing tools.   Ability to thrive in   a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.   Key Success Factors:   Successful   implementation and management of digital reward programs resulting in increased   partner engagement and revenue growth.   Strong relationships   built with key B2B channel partners, leading to high levels of partner   satisfaction and loyalty.   Regular monitoring   and analysis of program performance, leading to continuous optimization and   improvement.   Effective   collaboration with cross-functional teams, ensuring alignment of digital   reward initiatives with broader business objectives.   Compliance with all   relevant regulations and company policies related to digital reward programs.

column2: Manage Subscription Partnerships:    Identify and cultivate subscription partnerships to enhance platform growth. column2: Job Responsibilities: Showcase, promote, and sell the company's medications to physicians and relevant healthcare professionals primarily in fields such as pain and palliative care, oncology, and neuropsychiatry. Schedule and coordinate appointments with doctors, pharmacists, hospital medical teams, and other healthcare professionals, including both pre-arranged appointments and proactive 'cold' calling efforts to promote company medications. Contribute to the development and execution of the companys business strategy, providing valuable insights and feedback for 360-degree strategy refinement. Participate in sales meetings, conference calls, training sessions, and symposium circuits to stay informed and engaged with the company's objectives and initiatives. Regularly attend company meetings, technical data presentations, and briefings to stay up-to-date with the latest medical information provided by the company. Interpret, present, and discuss the latest medical data with healthcare professionals during presentations, ensuring they are well-informed about the company's products. Provide competitive intelligence, including bid situations, pricing data, and bundling arrangements, to facilitate negotiated pricing contracts for assigned products. Gather, analyze, and relay field information to assist the company in developing strategies and products aligned with quality and safety testing standards. Qualification Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy (B.Pharm or D.Pharm), Sciences (B.Sc.), Business Administration (BBA), or a related field. Proficiency in MS Office applications. Minimum of 5 years' experience as a sales representative or 1-2 years' experience as an Area Business Manager in the pharmaceutical or healthcare products industry (or a similar role). Familiarity with databases, statistics, product lines, and current medical issues. Skills: Confidence, determination, persistence, and a strong desire to learn. Effective planning, analytical, leadership, and organizational abilities. Adaptability to changes, especially in healthcare systems or product and drug formularies. Proficiency in general IT and administrative tasks. Dedication, self-motivation, and a focus on achieving success. Loyalty, intelligence, and honesty in all dealings. Basic knowledge of drugs and the pharmaceutical market. Proficiency in English language. Outstanding verbal and written communication, negotiation, and sales skills. Solid understanding of human anatomy and microbiology. Strong problem-solving capabilities. Preferably, a background in science. Ability to proactively pursue customers. Punctuality and time management skills. Aptitude for building strong relationships with customers. Capability to identify and capitalize on opportunities. Ability to thrive under pressure. Fluency in the local language is advantageous. What to expect: Achieving sales target assigned by the company Opportunities occur throughout India, but the job usually involves responsibility for a particular geographical area. Smart dress and a professional appearance are essential. The working day can be long due to the travelling time involved and you may need to socialise with clients or conduct presentations in the evenings, for example.

column2: Take a lead role in growing revenue in allotted Region relationships with Value Added Resellers (VARs) & Consultative Partners. To play a critical role in expanding the allotted market and be part of the global revolution taking place in digital distributed manufacturing as a result of the latest 3D printing technologies. The role will track and drive the KPI s and action plans to reach annual targets and develop measures to stay ahead, including actions to enable, develop, motivate and support the partners through regular meetings for pipeline management, marketing campaign planning, industry events, forecasting, etc.     Role & Responsibilities:       Demonstrate a deep understanding of channel strategy, and sales process         Develop a partner selection and recruitment framework to drive selection of the best-in-class   VARs and consultative partners within the region.         Work with the new and existing partners, set partner revenue and growth goals and drive   channel development plans to meet and exceed those goals.         Develop marketing strategy and action points to strategically position in the market and build   brand awareness via positive visibility.         Canvass, initiate, and qualify sales leads and follow through to ensure a solid sales funnel with all   partners.         Facilitate joint visits with partners sales representatives to end users         Achieve world class partner net promoter scores and excellent feedback from the customers of   our channel partners         Lead a diligent business rhythm with all partners - QBRs, MBRs, an executive sponsorship   mapping       Basic Qualifications:       Bachelors degree in Engineering, or a related field.         Proven experience (5+ years) in business development, sales, within the additive manufacturing   or industrial machinery industry.       Excellent in Communication Skills.       5+ years of B2B channel development experience including in-depth understanding of system   integrators, channel/partner programs and funnel management.         In depth experience with structured sales, plans, budgets, pipeline management, marketing and   people management in sales.         Extensive solution sales experience and track record working with value added resellers.         You enjoy working in a fast paced, constantly changing scale-up company with high ambition   levels, an environment which throws challenges and presents new opportunities for your future   development.         Empathy: track record of developing a deep understanding of our partners and customers and   turning those insights into strategies that result in significant revenue growth         Leadership: ability to recruit and grow excellent talent and create a team culture of winning while   respecting the company values - this role will be accountable for driving significant MRR through   our indirect channels         Manufacturing expertise - solid grasp of manufacturing industry with an emphasis on technical   solutions         Test and Learn Mind-set: ability to execute in an intense, face-pasted, highly iterative   environment         Cross-Functional Collaboration - experience collaborating effectively with key stakeholders and   cross-functional teams to achieve goals         Sales / Go-to-Market: demonstrated success developing and executing sales/marketing   enablement playbooks and tools to drive new business with/through for partners         Business Thinking: ability to identify and leverage synergies across the business to make an   impact         Execution Focused: motivated by success and passion for delivering business results;   demonstrated excellence in exceeding quota on a regular basis         Influence: ability to direct, persuade, and motivate others without direct authority; flexes   style/approach as the situation requires         Resiliency: adaptable to change and effective when facing ambiguity; thinks outside the box to   solve for key stakeholders in the short and long-term         Strategic Thinking: plans and makes decisions in the framework of the company strategy - ability   to help shape our partner strategy and modify our commercial models to drive significant   growth.       Bonus To Have:       Master s degree in engineering/Business Administration         In-depth knowledge of additive manufacturing technologies, processes, and applications.         Previous experience in working with advanced manufacturing technologies, machines and   equipment.         A network of contacts within industries that can benefit from additive manufacturing technology   is a plus.

column2: Job Brief: We are seeking a highly motivated Business Development Associate to join our IT software company. The successful candidate will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, developing relationships with potential clients, and helping to drive revenue growth for the company into the performance marketing division. Responsibilities: Identify and research potential clients and business opportunities in the IT software market. Develop and maintain relationships with potential clients, including conducting meetings and providing presentations. Generate leads through various channels including outbound calling, email campaigns, social media outreach, and events networking Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and implement targeted marketing campaigns. Participate in the development of sales strategies and plans to drive revenue growth. Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in the company's CRM system. Continuously monitor industry trends and stay up-to-date on the latest technology developments. Prepare and deliver proposals, contracts, and other sales-related documentation. Continuously monitor industry trends and stay up-to-date on the latest technology developments. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in business development or sales, preferably in the IT software industry only Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Comfortable with making outbound calls and conducting sales presentations. Proficient in the use of CRM systems such as Zoho CRM and other sales-related tools. Must be willing to travel as needed. We offer a competitive salary package, including a base salary and commission, as well as opportunities for growth and advancement within the company. If you are a self-starter with a passion for sales and a desire to drive business growth, we want to hear from you.

column1: Business Development Team Lead - New Delhi
column2: A bit about us Kolo is a product that focuses on making home building a delightful experience by providing our users with real and valuable inspiration, products, people, and services. As an early-stage startup, we believe in being goal-oriented, growth-focused, and energetically agile so that we can cater to our user base of more than a million across different cities in India. Being user-centric and hands-on is our work mantra. Our vision is to be a one-stop shop for all home construction needs and to be an inevitable product for every homeowner. Job Description: As a Team Lead  for Business Development Associates (BDA), you will be responsible for leading and managing a team of 5 to 10 BDAs to drive business growth and meet sales targets. Your primary focus will be on achieving the sales target numbers by guiding, mentoring, and coaching the team. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with other departments to ensure alignment of BDAs' efforts with organizational objectives. Key Responsibilities: Leadership and Ownership of Sales Numbers: Take full ownership of the team's sales numbers and revenue targets. Develop a results-driven mindset within the team, emphasizing accountability and ownership of individual and collective sales goals. Implement strategies to drive consistent performance and exceed sales targets. Lead by example, demonstrating a proactive approach to sales activities and maintaining a relentless focus on achieving results. Team Management and Motivation: Provide strong leadership and direction to the team, instilling a sense of urgency and commitment to achieving sales objectives. Motivate and inspire team members to consistently perform at their best, recognizing and rewarding exceptional performance. Foster a collaborative and supportive team environment where each member feels empowered to contribute to the team's success. Address any performance issues or challenges promptly and constructively, providing guidance and support to help team members improve. Sales Strategy Development and Execution: Develop and execute effective sales strategies tailored to meet or exceed revenue targets. Identify new business opportunities, market trends, and customer needs to inform strategic decision-making. Collaborate with key stakeholders to align sales strategies with overall business objectives and market dynamics. Continuously evaluate and refine sales strategies based on performance data and market feedback. Performance Monitoring and Analysis: Monitor and analyze sales performance metrics, including but not limited to revenue, conversion rates, pipeline growth, and customer acquisition costs. Identify trends, opportunities, and challenges in sales performance and take proactive measures to address them. Utilize data-driven insights to optimize sales processes, identify areas for improvement, and drive continuous performance improvement. Collaboration and Communication: Foster strong cross-functional collaboration with marketing, product, and customer success teams to support sales efforts and drive customer value. Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders to ensure alignment on sales objectives, priorities, and strategies. Facilitate open communication within the team, encouraging feedback, idea sharing, and knowledge exchange to enhance collective performance. Customer Relationship Management: Lead efforts to build and nurture strong relationships with key customers and strategic partners, driving loyalty and long-term revenue growth. Collaborate with BDAs to identify customer needs, overcome objections, and deliver exceptional value propositions. Proactively address customer concerns and ensure high levels of satisfaction throughout the sales process Who can apply 56 years of experience in Sales (Construction and Home interior industry experience preferred) Someone who has done sales large ticket sales through Video Demo. (Edtech, Adtech) Minimum 2 years of Team handling experience. Ability to cope with a fast-paced working environment Analytical and data-based decision making skills Ability to hit the ground and problem solve on priority Identifies builds and uses a wide network of contacts with people at all levels, internally and externally Achieves a good result through a well-planned approach Salary: Up to 80 K (Depending on interview performance and experience level) NP: Immediate -15 Days Work Location (In office ) : New Delhi / Cochin Experience: Ideally, Min : 5+ Years on business development roles. If interested, please share resume to  hr@koloapp.in

column2: Role & responsibilities    Are you a proactive, results-driven individual with a passion for forging meaningful connections and driving business growth? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Business Development Manager to join our team in Gurugram. As a key player in our organization, you will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, nurturing client relationships, and driving revenue growth.    Key Responsibilities: Strategic Business Development:  Develop and execute strategic plans to identify and pursue new business opportunities in alignment with company objectives. Utilize market insights and industry trends to drive business expansion and capitalize on emerging opportunities. Client Relationship Management:  Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with clients by understanding their needs, addressing concerns, and delivering exceptional service. Serve as a trusted advisor and primary point of contact to foster loyalty and drive repeat business. Networking and Outreach:  Leverage your exceptional networking skills to expand our client base and establish partnerships with key stakeholders. Actively participate in industry events, conferences, and networking forums to enhance brand visibility and generate leads. Sales and Revenue Generation:  Drive sales initiatives and meet revenue targets by effectively pitching our services, negotiating contracts, and closing deals. Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless execution and delivery of services to clients. Market Analysis and Research:  Conduct thorough market research and competitive analysis to identify market trends, potential growth areas, and competitive threats. Use data-driven insights to inform business decisions and refine sales strategies. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field; MBA preferred. Proven track record of success in business development, sales, or related roles, preferably in the recruitment or consulting industry. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and influence stakeholders at all levels. Strong analytical skills and business acumen, with the ability to interpret data and identify strategic opportunities. Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities. Proactive and results-oriented mindset, with a passion for driving business growth and exceeding targets. Fluency in English; additional language skills are a plus. Perks and benefits    At Crescendo Global, we offer a collaborative and supportive work environment where your contributions are valued and rewarded. You will have the opportunity to work with a diverse team of professionals and make a meaningful impact on our business and clients. We provide ongoing training and development opportunities to help you reach your full potential and advance your career. If you are ready to take your career to the next level and thrive in a dynamic and rewarding environment, we invite you to join us on this exciting journey!

Sales and Revenue Generation:          Achieve and exceed sales targets by actively promoting and selling our NDC technology.          Identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities within existing accounts.          Develop and implement effective sales strategies to drive revenue growth.              Educational Outreach:          Educate travel agents on the benefits and capabilities of our NDC technology.          Provide training sessions to ensure optimal utilization of our systems.          Act as a consultant to travel agents, offering insights into industry trends and best practices.              Technical Expertise:          Develop a deep understanding of our NDC technology and its integration capabilities.          Assist clients in integrating our systems through both B2B platforms and APIs.          Collaborate with technical support teams to address any integration issues.              Strategic Account Planning:          Create and implement strategic account plans to maximize growth opportunities.          Collaborate with internal teams to align product development with customer needs.          Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics.              Relationship Building:          Foster strong relationships at all levels within customer organizations.          Engage with key decision-makers to understand their business goals and challenges.          Position our technology as a critical component of the customer's success.              Reporting and Analytics:          Provide regular and accurate sales forecasts, reports, and updates.          Update regular activities, plans and forecast on the CRM          Utilize data and analytics to identify trends, track performance, and make informed decisions.              Team Collaboration:          Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product development, technology and customer support.          Share market insights and customer feedback to enhance overall company strategies.                        Desired Skills & Competencies                MBA preferred. Bachelors degree in business administration, Marketing, or a related field.          Proven experience in B2B sales, preferably within the airline distribution or travel technology industry.          Familiarity with New Distribution Capability (NDC) and understanding of airline distribution channels.          Strong negotiation, presentation, and communication skills.          Ability to grasp technical concepts and articulate them to non-technical audiences.          Results-oriented with a track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.          Exceptional relationship-building skills and a customer-focused mindset.          Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce). column2: Job Responsibilities: Showcase, promote, and sell the company's medications to physicians and relevant healthcare professionals primarily in fields such as pain and palliative care, oncology, and neuropsychiatry. Schedule and coordinate appointments with doctors, pharmacists, hospital medical teams, and other healthcare professionals, including both pre-arranged appointments and proactive 'cold' calling efforts to promote company medications. Contribute to the development and execution of the companys business strategy, providing valuable insights and feedback for 360-degree strategy refinement. Participate in sales meetings, conference calls, training sessions, and symposium circuits to stay informed and engaged with the company's objectives and initiatives. Regularly attend company meetings, technical data presentations, and briefings to stay up-to-date with the latest medical information provided by the company. Interpret, present, and discuss the latest medical data with healthcare professionals during presentations, ensuring they are well-informed about the company's products. Provide competitive intelligence, including bid situations, pricing data, and bundling arrangements, to facilitate negotiated pricing contracts for assigned products. Gather, analyze, and relay field information to assist the company in developing strategies and products aligned with quality and safety testing standards. Qualification Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy (B.Pharm or D.Pharm), Sciences (B.Sc.), Business Administration (BBA), or a related field. Proficiency in MS Office applications. Minimum of 5 years' experience as a sales representative or 1-2 years' experience as an Area Business Manager in the pharmaceutical or healthcare products industry (or a similar role). Familiarity with databases, statistics, product lines, and current medical issues. Skills: Confidence, determination, persistence, and a strong desire to learn. Effective planning, analytical, leadership, and organizational abilities. Adaptability to changes, especially in healthcare systems or product and drug formularies. Proficiency in general IT and administrative tasks. Dedication, self-motivation, and a focus on achieving success. Loyalty, intelligence, and honesty in all dealings. Basic knowledge of drugs and the pharmaceutical market. Proficiency in English language. Outstanding verbal and written communication, negotiation, and sales skills. Solid understanding of human anatomy and microbiology. Strong problem-solving capabilities. Preferably, a background in science. Ability to proactively pursue customers. Punctuality and time management skills. Aptitude for building strong relationships with customers. Capability to identify and capitalize on opportunities. Ability to thrive under pressure. Fluency in the local language is advantageous. What to expect: Achieving sales target assigned by the company Opportunities occur throughout India, but the job usually involves responsibility for a particular geographical area. Smart dress and a professional appearance are essential. The working day can be long due to the travelling time involved and you may need to socialise with clients or conduct presentations in the evenings, for example.

column2: Role & responsibilities   1. Develop and implement strategic sales plans to achieve company targets for revenue growth and profitability within the warehousing and distribution segment.  2. Identify and pursue new business opportunities through market research, networking, and prospecting activities.  3. Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including potential clients, industry partners, and government agencies.  4. Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless coordination and execution of logistics solutions, meeting customer expectations and operational requirements.  5. Conduct regular market analysis and competitor benchmarking to identify emerging trends and opportunities for differentiation.  6. Prepare and present persuasive sales proposals, negotiate contracts, and close deals in alignment with company objectives.  7. Monitor and analyze sales performance metrics, providing regular reports and insights to senior management.  8. Stay updated on industry regulations, compliance standards, and best practices, ensuring adherence to legal and ethical guidelines.  9. Mentor and coach junior sales team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development  Preferred candidate profile    1. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Logistics Management, or a related field. MBA preferred.  2. Proven track record of successful sales achievements in the logistics industry, with at least 5 years of experience in a similar role.  3. In-depth knowledge of warehousing and distribution operations, including inventory management, order fulfillment, and transportation logistics.  4. Familiarity with the Indian logistics market, including key players, market dynamics, and regulatory environment.  5. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and develop actionable insights.  6. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and negotiate effectively with diverse stakeholders.  7. Demonstrated leadership abilities, with a proactive and results-driven approach to problem-solving and decision-making.  8. Proficiency in MS Office suite and CRM software. Experience with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle) is a plus.  9. Willingness to travel as needed to meet with clients, attend industry events, and visit operational facilities.  Perks and benefits   This role offers an exciting opportunity to drive business growth and shape the future of our logistics operations in India. If you are a motivated self-starter with a passion for sales and a deep understanding of the warehousing and distribution business, we encourage you to apply.

column2: The Country Manager is being recruited, in a full-time position, to lead aQysta's operations in Assam, and is responsible that aQysta s sales and financial growth targets in for growth in North East India are met.             The Country Manager will work on to build partnership for sales & growth as we'll as to build and maintain relationship with farmers and FPOs.             The Country Manager will work closely with the international team of aQysta to ensure that the strategy and growth milestones in Assam are in line with the company s global strategy.             JOB PROFILE             Do you have the spirit of an entrepreneur? Do you want to grow a business?             Are you passionate about solving the challenges of smallholder farmers of north-east India?           If the answers to the above questions are yes, then this could be the perfect position for you where you can apply your professional passion to head aQysta s Assam team, to drive sales and operations of aQysta s Assam office, while being an important part of the global aQysta team.         You as aQysta Assam s Country Manager will lead the team in Guwahati and drive to set and achieve the company s annual goals.         As such, this position manager will be at the heart of aQysta s strategic operations and gain a deep insight into the short, mid, and long-term strategy of the company.           RESPONSIBILITIES             Meet the defined     sales and growth targets together with Assam team &      international     team             Lead team in Assam to achieve their targets by mobilizing the available resources.             Define and improve sales and operations processes & procedures              Set annual budgets and month-on-month financial planning and implementing them with the admin team in Guwahati.              Represent aQysta at events in and outside Assam/India             Manage and enforce the use of ERP to safeguard business processes (purchase, sales, delivery, reimbursements)             Collect data about sales metrics of Assam & analyse to suggest improvement in business model and products on a country level.             Manage projects in India with strategic help from the global team             Manage team Assam by ensuring positive working environment for learning and growth.             Ensure all the compliances of aQysta India entity are met.             Support the international team in the fundraising activities for aQysta India           BACKGROUND             Having a Masters Degree, preferably MBA/MBS in business / agriculture / entrepreneurship             Preferably from North-east India or willing to relocate to Guwahati, Assam             Having relevant previous work experience of 3-5 years in the food sector (eg processing, trade, export)             Demonstration of strategic management skills, knowledge about goal setting, people skills and general management             Comfortable communicating with people from diverse cultural backgrounds and with all levels of management internally and externally              Good in external communications and public relations             Good project management skills             Financial management skills              Knowledge of general management skills & experience in operations management             High accountability and sense of responsibility

column2: Company Overview: English Browne India Limited is a leading company in the Hygiene and Health FMCG Industry dedicated to delivering high-quality products and services to our customers. We are committed to excellence and innovation, and we prioritize building strong relationships with our clients and partners. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a talented Key Account Manager to join our team and play a pivotal role in managing key accounts and driving sales performance. Job Summary: The Key Account Manager will be responsible for managing key client accounts, overseeing daily sales reporting, tracking performance metrics, conducting sales analysis, nurturing vendor relationships, and ensuring target completion and achievement for English Browne India Limited. This role requires a proactive and strategic thinker who can effectively manage relationships, analyze sales data, and drive results to meet company objectives. Responsibilities: Manage Key Client Accounts: Develop and maintain strong relationships with key clients to understand their needs and requirements. Serve as the primary point of contact for key accounts and address any inquiries or concerns in a timely manner. Collaborate with internal teams to ensure client satisfaction and successful delivery of products and services. 2. Daily Sales Reporting and Performance Tracking: Oversee daily reporting of sales activities by sales employees. Track key performance metrics and analyze sales data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement. Provide regular updates on sales performance to senior management and relevant stakeholders 3. Sales Analysis: Conduct in-depth sales analysis to identify strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats in the market. Develop actionable insights and recommendations based on sales data to optimize performance and drive growth. Vendor Relationship Management: Cultivate and maintain relationships with vendors and suppliers to ensure timely delivery of products and services. Negotiate favorable terms and agreements with vendors to maximize value for English Browne India Limited. Target Completion and Achievement: Develop and implement strategies to achieve sales targets and objectives set by the company. Monitor progress towards targets and take corrective actions as needed to ensure targets are met or exceeded. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field (Master's degree preferred). Proven experience in key account management, sales reporting, and analysis. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret sales data and trends. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to build and maintain relationships with clients, vendors, and internal teams. Proactive and results-oriented with a focus on driving performance and achieving targets. Join us at English Browne India Limited and be part of a dynamic team dedicated to excellence and innovation in the FMCG Industry. If you are passionate about building relationships, driving sales performance, and achieving results, we want to hear from you! Apply now by submitting your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications.

column2: The Job  Digiboxx.com Indias 1st storage & asset management platform is looking for Sales Manager - Tech Enterprise. You will be responsible for sourcing new customers and business contacts, demonstrate the technical features of our product, drive sales and maintain strong customer relations.  You will primarily drive B2B sales, large-scale accounts and high-value contracts. One of your main responsibilities would be to identify new opportunities to expand markets and drive business growth while also enabling increased revenue from current accounts. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Sourcing potential new enterprise customers, create thick sales funnel and ensure account penetration. Maintaining regular contact with existing customers to ensure strong relationship. column2: 8-10+ years of technology-related sales or account management experience          OR Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field AND 7+ years of technology-related sales or account management experience.          OR Equivalent experience                         Additional or Preferred Qualifications (PQs)             6+ years of solution sales or consulting services sales experience:          Experience with selling CRM/ERP or similar software-as-a-service, cloud-based business applications to large enterprise accounts exceeding sales targets.                    Tasks           As a Business Applications Sales Executive you will be an industry-aligned, outcome-driven business process transformation enabler within the Microsoft Specialist sales organization working with our most important customers helping them with their end-to-end business transformation needs by envisioning solutions and mapping capabilities with associated business value to business decision maker persona pains/needs     You will execute with excellence the entire sales process by owning and orchestrating a virtual pursuit team of technically intense workload (solution) experts including presales, co-sell partners, and Independent Software Vendors to provide customers with solutions aligned to their end-to-end business transformation needs using Microsoft Business Applications portfolio of offerings                Job Responsibilities                 Sales Execution             Engages in conversation with customers aligned to their industry and collaborates with account and partner team to drive and qualify new opportunities and build pipeline.          Identifies customer business and technology readiness, proactively builds external stakeholders mapping, implements strategies to accelerate the closing of deals, contributes input on strategies to drive and close prioritized opportunities, coaches junior team members in deal plan execution, and implements close plans.              Scaling and Collaboration             Applies role orchestration model and navigates the Microsoft organization to bring the best impact to the customer.          Collaborates with Global Partner Solutions (GPS), identifies new partners, develops joint proposals with partners, and contributes to developing partner strategies.              Technical Expertise             Leverages and shares competitor knowledge across solution areas as a subject matter expert to inform decisions on pursuit or withdrawal. Leads conversations and sets up events within Microsoft, mentors others and develops strategies for best practice sharing, initiates conversations with prospective customers/partners at events, acts as a subject matter expert in one or more solution area(s).         Collaborates with the compete SMEs internally to analyze competitor products, solutions, and/or services and implement strategies.              Delivers Results Through Teamwork             Drives the execution of projects, partners and collaborates with other teams on related deliverables, and leverages others in relevant work streams.              Account Planning and CXO/BDM Engagement with Industry Expertise             Deliver quality account and quota retirement territory plans          Drive BDM/CXO connections/engagements with Business Value Insights aligned to industry-relevant connected use cases          Build & maintain 3x qualified pipeline coverage by translating BDM priorities to initiatives              Best-in-class Business Value Selling             Lead customer Envisioning in each opportunity, yielding output of customer agreed business challenges, prioritized with business value and v-team accountabilities          Deliver compelling board-level proposals with commercial options aligned to customer transformation plan and business value          Create business outcome and industry thought leadership customer stories and references              Next Generation Sales Execution Excellence             Usage of digital-first seller tools to identify and grow qualified pipeline and opportunities.          Orchestrate the sales process and customer journey leveraging the Microsoft Customer Engagement Methodology to increase win rates and customer satisfaction.          Leverage the Microsoft partner ecosystem to scale and complement solution selling.

column2: Job Responsibilities: Showcase, promote, and sell the company's medications to physicians and relevant healthcare professionals primarily in fields such as pain and palliative care, oncology, and neuropsychiatry. Schedule and coordinate appointments with doctors, pharmacists, hospital medical teams, and other healthcare professionals, including both pre-arranged appointments and proactive 'cold' calling efforts to promote company medications. Contribute to the development and execution of the companys business strategy, providing valuable insights and feedback for 360-degree strategy refinement. Participate in sales meetings, conference calls, training sessions, and symposium circuits to stay informed and engaged with the company's objectives and initiatives. Regularly attend company meetings, technical data presentations, and briefings to stay up-to-date with the latest medical information provided by the company. Interpret, present, and discuss the latest medical data with healthcare professionals during presentations, ensuring they are well-informed about the company's products. Provide competitive intelligence, including bid situations, pricing data, and bundling arrangements, to facilitate negotiated pricing contracts for assigned products. Gather, analyze, and relay field information to assist the company in developing strategies and products aligned with quality and safety testing standards. Qualification Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy (B.Pharm or D.Pharm), Sciences (B.Sc.), Business Administration (BBA), or a related field. Proficiency in MS Office applications. Minimum of 5 years' experience as a sales representative or 1-2 years' experience as an Area Business Manager in the pharmaceutical or healthcare products industry (or a similar role). Familiarity with databases, statistics, product lines, and current medical issues. Skills: Confidence, determination, persistence, and a strong desire to learn. Effective planning, analytical, leadership, and organizational abilities. Adaptability to changes, especially in healthcare systems or product and drug formularies. Proficiency in general IT and administrative tasks. Dedication, self-motivation, and a focus on achieving success. Loyalty, intelligence, and honesty in all dealings. Basic knowledge of drugs and the pharmaceutical market. Proficiency in English language. Outstanding verbal and written communication, negotiation, and sales skills. Solid understanding of human anatomy and microbiology. Strong problem-solving capabilities. Preferably, a background in science. Ability to proactively pursue customers. Punctuality and time management skills. Aptitude for building strong relationships with customers. Capability to identify and capitalize on opportunities. Ability to thrive under pressure. Fluency in the local language is advantageous. What to expect: Achieving sales target assigned by the company Opportunities occur throughout India, but the job usually involves responsibility for a particular geographical area. Smart dress and a professional appearance are essential. The working day can be long due to the travelling time involved and you may need to socialise with clients or conduct presentations in the evenings, for example.
column11: pharma sales, Medical sales, selling, Medical Representative, Key account management, medical marketing

column2: Role & responsibilities     Sales and Business Development:  Actively seek out new customers and sales opportunities within the assigned territory or market segment.  Develop and execute sales strategies to achieve or exceed sales targets and objectives.  Identify potential clients and conduct market research to understand their needs and preferences.  Present product offerings, negotiate, and close sales deals effectively.  Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and industry developments to capitalize on opportunities and mitigate threats.  Identify the growth driver for Market Movement  Customer Relationship Management:  Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients through regular communication and follow-ups.  Provide excellent customer service by addressing client inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction.  Understand clients' requirements and tailor solutions to meet their specific needs and preferences.  Collaborate with internal teams such as logistics, operations, and finance to ensure seamless order processing and delivery.  Stay updated on agricultural commodity markets, including pricing trends, supply and demand dynamics, and regulatory changes.  Educate clients on the features, benefits, and applications of various agricultural commodities.  Conduct product presentations, demonstrations, and training sessions for clients as needed. Reporting and Documentation:  Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and market intelligence using.  Prepare sales reports, forecasts, and analyses for management review.  Provide timely and insightful feedback to management regarding market conditions, customer preferences, and competitive landscape. . Preferred candidate profile   Qualifications and Skills:  Full time Bachelor's degree in Agriculture, Agribusiness, Business Administration, or related field.  Proven track record of success in agricultural commodity sales or a related field.  Strong understanding of agricultural markets, commodities, and trading practices.  Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.  Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel & Power point is mandatory)   Willingness to travel within the assigned territory or region as needed Perks and benefits

column2: The Bid Manager will be responsible for managing the end-to-end process of preparing and submitting bids for government and commercial tenders      This role requires expertise in handling tender documentation, coordinating with various departments, and ensuring timely submission and follow-up on proposals      The ideal candidate will have a strong background in IT infrastructure services and experience with the Government e-Marketplace (GeM) portal/e-tendering portals          Key Responsibilities:          Tender Management:          Select and review tenders from the GeM portal and other e-tendering platforms. column2: Job Responsibilities: Showcase, promote, and sell the company's medications to physicians and relevant healthcare professionals primarily in fields such as pain and palliative care, oncology, and neuropsychiatry. Schedule and coordinate appointments with doctors, pharmacists, hospital medical teams, and other healthcare professionals, including both pre-arranged appointments and proactive 'cold' calling efforts to promote company medications. Contribute to the development and execution of the companys business strategy, providing valuable insights and feedback for 360-degree strategy refinement. Participate in sales meetings, conference calls, training sessions, and symposium circuits to stay informed and engaged with the company's objectives and initiatives. Regularly attend company meetings, technical data presentations, and briefings to stay up-to-date with the latest medical information provided by the company. Interpret, present, and discuss the latest medical data with healthcare professionals during presentations, ensuring they are well-informed about the company's products. Provide competitive intelligence, including bid situations, pricing data, and bundling arrangements, to facilitate negotiated pricing contracts for assigned products. Gather, analyze, and relay field information to assist the company in developing strategies and products aligned with quality and safety testing standards. Qualification Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy (B.Pharm or D.Pharm), Sciences (B.Sc.), Business Administration (BBA), or a related field. Proficiency in MS Office applications. Minimum of 5 years' experience as a sales representative or 1-2 years' experience as an Area Business Manager in the pharmaceutical or healthcare products industry (or a similar role). Familiarity with databases, statistics, product lines, and current medical issues. Skills: Confidence, determination, persistence, and a strong desire to learn. Effective planning, analytical, leadership, and organizational abilities. Adaptability to changes, especially in healthcare systems or product and drug formularies. Proficiency in general IT and administrative tasks. Dedication, self-motivation, and a focus on achieving success. Loyalty, intelligence, and honesty in all dealings. Basic knowledge of drugs and the pharmaceutical market. Proficiency in English language. Outstanding verbal and written communication, negotiation, and sales skills. Solid understanding of human anatomy and microbiology. Strong problem-solving capabilities. Preferably, a background in science. Ability to proactively pursue customers. Punctuality and time management skills. Aptitude for building strong relationships with customers. Capability to identify and capitalize on opportunities. Ability to thrive under pressure. Fluency in the local language is advantageous. Smart dress and a professional appearance are essential. column2: The Manager/Assistant Manager Franchisee is responsible for managing and supporting franchisees to ensure they meet business standards and targets.      This includes providing ongoing coaching, resolving issues, conducting regular audits, and ensuring compliance with company policies.      Additionally, the role involves onboarding new franchisees, guiding them through the development phase, and ensuring they have the resources and support needed for successful integration into the company's network.         Duties and responsibilities         Act as the primary point of contact for franchisees, addressing their concerns and facilitating communication between them and the corporate office.     Build and maintain strong relationships with franchisees to foster a positive and productive franchise network.     Address and resolve any issues or concerns that arise during the franchisee development process.     Provide ongoing support to franchisees to ensure they meet business standards and targets.     Monitor franchisee performance and provide feedback and coaching to improve profitability and efficiency.     Ensure all franchisees adhere to company policies, procedures, and brand standards.     Conduct regular reviews and audits of franchisee operations.     Address and resolve any compliance issues promptly.     Conduct market research to identify potential markets for franchise expansion.     Conduct interviews and assessments of potential franchisees to determine suitability.     Guide potential franchisees through the entire development process, including application, business planning, financing, and site selection.     Work with legal, finance, and operations teams to ensure franchise agreements are executed properly.     Collaborate with the business/operations team to develop comprehensive training programs for new franchisees.     Ensure franchisees receive ongoing support and guidance during the initial setup phase and beyond.     Develop and deliver comprehensive training programs for new and existing franchisees         Job requirements             bachelors degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.     8+ years of experience in franchise management and operations.     Strong understanding of franchise laws and regulations.     Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.     Proven ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.     Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.     Proficiency in CRM software and Microsoft Office Suite.     Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret performance data and financial reports.     Ability to travel frequently to franchise locations.     Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software

column2: About ETS:   ETS is a global education and talent solutions organization, enabling lifelong learners to be future ready. We advance the science of measurement to build the benchmarks for fair and valid skill assessment. We are committed to powering human progress by promoting skill proficiency, empowering upward mobility, and unlocking more opportunities for everyone, everywhere. For more than 70 years, we have developed products and services based on rigorous research and our belief in the power of learning. Our portfolio consists of some of the worlds most trusted assessments - including the TOEFL? and TOEIC? exams, the GRE? and the Praxis? family of assessments - along with research, development and innovation that explores new frontiers in learning and measurement. Our educational measurement solutions and research contribute to the development of new methods and tools, inform important dialogue with education policymakers, and shed light on critical issues and potential solutions - all with the aim of creating a world where all learners are able to improve their lives through education. column2: Job Title: Distribution Manager - Dunlop Join our esteemed team at Dunlop, a leading manufacturer of high-quality tyres committed to delivering superior performance and safety to customers across the globe. With a legacy of innovation and excellence, we are dedicated to providing top-notch products and services to meet the diverse needs of our consumers. Position Overview:  We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Distribution Manager to oversee the efficient distribution of our tyres within the designated region. The ideal candidate will be someone who can work in a fast-paced environment, over-deliver on given targets & register exponential growth for the Dunlop brand. Key Responsibilities: Distribution Network Management: Develop and implement strategic plans to optimize the distribution network for Dunlop within the assigned region Identify and on-board new distributors & super-stockists to expand market reach and penetration Regularly evaluate the performance of existing channel partners and implement strategies to enhance their effectiveness. Ensure adherence to company policies and standards across the distribution network. Inventory Management: Monitor inventory levels at super-stockists, distributors, and dealers to prevent stockouts and minimize excess inventory Collaborate with logistics and sales teams to forecast demand and maintain optimal inventory levels at each distribution point. Implement efficient inventory replenishment processes to ensure product availability and minimize carrying costs. Logistics Coordination: Coordinate with logistics team to ensure timely delivery of tyres from our godowns to distributors & super-stockists Resolve logistics-related issues, such as transportation delays or damages, to minimize disruptions to the supply chain Team Leadership: Lead and manage a team of sales officers to achieve performance targets and objectives. Provide mentoring, training, and performance feedback to team members to enhance their skills and capabilities. Qualifications: Masters degree in Business Administration will be preferred Proven experience of minimum 5 years in distribution management within the FMCD sector, with a strong focus on channel appointment & retention strategies. Excellent leadership skills with the ability to motivate and develop cross-functional teams. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Proficiency in distribution management software and tools. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.

column2: Organization: Claptek Pvt Ltd URL: www.claptek.com Job Title: Senior Key Account Manager Job Location: Mumbai Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled, go-getter and passionate Senior Key Account Manager who possesses a deep understanding of Key Account Management (KAM) principles. The ideal candidate will excel in mapping and managing large to very large accounts, demonstrating confidence in engaging with board members and senior leadership within these organizations. Responsibilities: 1.	Identify Your Ideal Client: Identify the potential leads and develop action plans to convert the new clients into business. 2.	Account Mapping and Management: Efficiently map and manage key accounts, establishing strong relationships with key stakeholders including board members and senior leadership. 3.	Consultative Sales: Utilize a consultative approach to understand the unique challenges and opportunities within each account, effectively positioning our solutions to address their needs. 4.	Commercial Model Development: Collaborate with internal teams to develop tailored commercial models that align with the objectives of each key account, ensuring mutual benefit and long-term partnership. 5.	Growth Strategy Identification: Identify growth opportunities within key accounts, devising strategic plans to maximize revenue and market share. 6.	Goal-Oriented Approach: Drive towards achieving key performance indicators (KPIs) and organizational growth objectives, maintaining a clear focus on delivering results. Requirements: 1.	Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field. Master's degree preferred. 2.	Proven experience in Key Account Management, preferably in a B2B environment, with a track record of successfully managing large accounts. 3.	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with senior-level stakeholders. 4.	Strong problem-solving abilities, with a knack for understanding complex business challenges and proposing innovative solutions. 5.	Results-driven mindset with a demonstrated ability to meet and exceed sales targets and KPIs. 6.	Strategic thinking and the ability to develop and execute growth strategies tailored to individual accounts. 7.	Flexibility to travel as needed to meet with clients and attend industry events. If you are a proactive and goal-oriented individual with a passion for driving organizational growth through strategic account management, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

column2: The Key Account Manager will play a pivotal role in Morepen Rx Business Success, responsible for nurturing and maintaining relationships with key clients, including hospitals, institutions, government hospitals, and procurement teams. This role requires a strategic approach to account management, focusing on understanding client needs, providing exceptional service, and driving business growth. Key Responsibilities: Client Relationship Management:  Develop and maintain strong relationships with key clients, including hospitals, government hospitals, and procurement teams. Act as the primary point of contact for client inquiries, concerns, and business opportunities. Conduct regular meetings with clients to understand their needs, address any issues, and identify opportunities for collaboration and growth. Business Development:  Identify and pursue new business opportunities within existing key accounts. Collaborate with internal teams, including sales, marketing, and product development, to develop strategies for expanding business with key clients. Stay updated on industry trends, market developments, and competitor activities to identify potential business opportunities. Account Planning and Strategy:  Develop strategic account plans for key clients, outlining objectives, tactics, and timelines for achieving business goals. Analyze client data and market insights to identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to enhance client satisfaction and loyalty. Monitor key account performance against established metrics and take corrective actions as needed to ensure targets are met or exceeded. Cross-functional Collaboration:  Collaborate closely with internal departments, including sales, marketing, supply chain, and finance, to ensure alignment on client needs and business objectives. Coordinate with the sales team to ensure effective communication and seamless execution of account strategies and initiatives. Contract Negotiation and Management:  Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with key clients, ensuring alignment with company policies and objectives. Monitor contract compliance and performance, addressing any discrepancies or issues in a timely manner. Renew and renegotiate contracts as needed, leveraging insights and feedback from clients to enhance value propositions. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Pharmacy, or related field. Advanced degree or MBA preferred. Proven experience of more than 5+ Years in key account management, preferably in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry. Strong understanding of the pharmaceutical market landscape, including knowledge of hospital procurement processes and regulatory requirements. Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. Strategic thinker with the ability to develop and execute account plans to drive business growth. Proficient in MS Office Suite and CRM software. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Willingness to travel as needed to meet with clients and attend industry events. column2: Job Responsibilities: Showcase, promote, and sell the company's medications to physicians and relevant healthcare professionals primarily in fields such as pain and palliative care, oncology, and neuropsychiatry. Schedule and coordinate appointments with doctors, pharmacists, hospital medical teams, and other healthcare professionals, including both pre-arranged appointments and proactive 'cold' calling efforts to promote company medications. Contribute to the development and execution of the companys business strategy, providing valuable insights and feedback for 360-degree strategy refinement. Participate in sales meetings, conference calls, training sessions, and symposium circuits to stay informed and engaged with the company's objectives and initiatives. Regularly attend company meetings, technical data presentations, and briefings to stay up-to-date with the latest medical information provided by the company. Interpret, present, and discuss the latest medical data with healthcare professionals during presentations, ensuring they are well-informed about the company's products. Provide competitive intelligence, including bid situations, pricing data, and bundling arrangements, to facilitate negotiated pricing contracts for assigned products. Gather, analyze, and relay field information to assist the company in developing strategies and products aligned with quality and safety testing standards. Qualification Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy (B.Pharm or D.Pharm), Sciences (B.Sc.), Business Administration (BBA), or a related field. Proficiency in MS Office applications. Minimum of 5 years' experience as a sales representative or 1-2 years' experience as an Area Business Manager in the pharmaceutical or healthcare products industry (or a similar role). Familiarity with databases, statistics, product lines, and current medical issues. Skills: Confidence, determination, persistence, and a strong desire to learn. Effective planning, analytical, leadership, and organizational abilities. Adaptability to changes, especially in healthcare systems or product and drug formularies. Proficiency in general IT and administrative tasks. Dedication, self-motivation, and a focus on achieving success. Loyalty, intelligence, and honesty in all dealings. Basic knowledge of drugs and the pharmaceutical market. Proficiency in English language. Outstanding verbal and written communication, negotiation, and sales skills. Solid understanding of human anatomy and microbiology. Strong problem-solving capabilities. Preferably, a background in science. Ability to proactively pursue customers. Punctuality and time management skills. Aptitude for building strong relationships with customers. Capability to identify and capitalize on opportunities. Ability to thrive under pressure. Fluency in the local language is advantageous. What to expect: Achieving sales target assigned by the company Opportunities occur throughout India, but the job usually involves responsibility for a particular geographical area. Smart dress and a professional appearance are essential. The working day can be long due to the travelling time involved and you may need to socialise with clients or conduct presentations in the evenings, for example.

column2: As a leading global organization focused on delivering innovative solutions, Trask is seeking a talented and experienced Enterprise Business Manager to join our team      This pivotal role will involve aligning business objectives with technology solutions to drive sustainable growth and maximize value for our enterprise clients      If you have a strong business acumen, exceptional leadership skills, and a passion for developing strategic partnerships, keep reading to learn more about this exciting opportunity        Responsibilities:    1. Develop and execute strategies:    Collaborate with key stakeholders to create and implement strategic business plans that align with Trasks overall goals and objectives. Identify emerging trends, market opportunities, and potential risks to make informed business decisions.        2. Client relationship management:    Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with existing enterprise clients. Identify opportunities for upselling, cross-selling, and enhancing customer satisfaction.        3. Team leadership and coordination:    Build and lead a high-performing team of professionals specialized in enterprise sales, account management, and project delivery. Set clear objectives, provide guidance, monitor performance, and foster a collaborative work environment to achieve team goals.        6. Stay abreast of industry trends:    Continuously monitor the market landscape, competitor strategies, and emerging technologies to provide strategic insights and recommendations. Share industry knowledge and best practices with internal teams to drive innovation and maintain a competitive edge.        Requirements:      1. Minimum of 5 years of experience in enterprise sales, business development, or key account management in the technology industry.      2. Bachelors degree in business administration, marketing, or a related field. An MBA or advanced degree is highly desirable.      3. Proven track record of building and managing successful client relationships, achieving sales targets, and driving revenue growth in the enterprise market segment.      4. Strong business acumen, with a deep understanding of major industry trends, dynamics, and key drivers impacting enterprise businesses.      5. Excellent leadership and communication skills to effectively lead a team, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.      6. Ability to think strategically, analyze complex business scenarios, and develop actionable plans to achieve positive outcomes.      7. Proactive and results-driven mindset with a focus on exceeding client expectations and delivering value-added solutions that drive growth.      8. Strong negotiation, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with a highly customer-centric approach

Making the initial connect with key influencers & decision makers, making the elevator pitch, and undertaking initial discovery calls with prospects.        Funnel Management & Conversion:    Orchestrating across all internal teams to respond to all prospect/client requests, progress the sales opportunity across all stages of the pipeline and take them to closure. This would also involve RFI/RFP responses, Pricing proposals, Contract negotiations, etc. Ensure that Sales targets are met by building a healthy sales funnel.        Pipeline review & progress:    Working backwards from the Sales targets, ensure that a healthy sales funnel is created by building, engaging/nurturing prospects and accelerating sales lead-times. Presenting pipeline progress to key management stakeholders internally.        Relationship management:    Full ownership of the Account post-closure. This would involve demonstrating thought leadership in offering the right solutions to client requirements, responding/resolving client queries and concerns, ensuring that the company continues to remain well positioned within the client organization. Also involves strategically mapping out the client organization to identify cross-sell/up-sell opportunities. Participate in Client/business reviews. This would also involve traveling to meet clients onsite periodically.          Requirement          Degree in marketing, business administration, or similar.      Extensive sales experience.      Intuitive and insightful, particularly regarding human behavior.      Ability to generate revenue by identifying pain points and suggesting suitable products or services.      Professional yet affable disposition.      Neat, well-groomed appearance.      Great networking skills.      Excellent written and verbal communication.      Resourceful, with outstanding research skills.      Emboldened by challenges.      Flexibility to work across shifts and locations

column2: What would you do? Within S&C Global Network, the global IX Topic Advisory team is an extension of our global IX practice, working with practitioners (senior managers and above), functional / industry subject matter experts, and client account leadership to help client teams to originate deals, develop conversation starters, proposals, discussion documents and preliminary analyses, and craft tailored proposals. The IX Topic Advisor will typically develop proposals around the notions of value creation for the engineering and manufacturing heads of office, in line with Accenture's dedicated end-to-end offerings: Engineering/manufacturing Digital transformation journey and strategy (eg :transformation and impacts on process, methods and tools, HR impacts..), supporting on reimagining the products our client make and how they make them, Digital thread/digital twin and manufacturing solutions implementation covering the different phases of the project from Definition to Maintenance (MOM/MES offerings, Capital projects, Manufacturing planning, End-to-End (E2E) Product digital thread, Smart Connected products, Robotics..) and ensure the relation with related software vendors (Dassault Systmes, Siemens, PTC, IBM, SAP..) Support business in their day-to-day activities and in their E2E transformation (eg. Acting as client business team representatives:dealing with inspections, quality process, product design, sustainability management, Monitor and deliver the entire change management for our clients) The IX  Topic Advisory Consultant a cts as an extension of the client team, writing content for all or parts of the proposal depending on the complexity of the opportunity. They provide a single point of contact for internal clients globally, building and managing stakeholder relationships and developing trusted partnerships. Role and Responsibilities Helps to create winning proposals for IX clients, in some cases from end to end, interacting with practitioners across Accenture, industry and functional subject matter experts, and other teams as needed. Works with the IX practice leadership to support deal proposals and origination (e.g., sales pitches, initial client conversations, positioning papers, and other origination efforts) Collaborates with deal teams through proposal storyboarding sessions and aligns content and messaging for conversation starters, proposals, oral presentations, and other materials. Helps to build and maintain sales and delivery assets (e.g., stage-0 decks, capability overviews, playbooks, service catalogues) Harvests content collaboratively to help Accenture's global knowledge/content management teams maintain a repository of the latest sales and delivery assets (e.g., credentials, proposals, deliverables, and resumes) Helps to coordinate work with other supporting teams (e.g., graphics designers, research analysts) to provide a single point of contact for internal clients. Qualification What are we looking for? Structured thinking with a quantitative mindset Knowledge of the IX deal lifecycle, both pre- and post-deal, including IX offers, definitions and solution costing associated with and related Sales Solutioning Minimum of 5-year experience working on Engineering and/or Manufacturing assignments and programs in a client delivery or pre-sales role Confidence working under time pressure and in fast-paced environments. Ability to conduct research work and analyses in autonomy, e.g. go to market, account plans and client profiling, vendors partnership strategy. Proven relationship management skills at all levels and ability to manage in a professional setting. Collaborative attitude for working and interacting with deal teams effectively in a virtual environment. Mastery of English at a professional level (oral and written) Understanding of business development work and proposal development / writing experience, challenging the deal team to optimise and value our outputs. Executive oral and written communication skills (clarity, consistency, conciseness) Proficient use of PowerPoint / Excel to structure slides and spreadsheets.
